thread_title: Suncorp Group 2026 Graduate & 2025 Intern Programs -  Graduate programs
author: SuncorpGrads
content: User #646401 273 posts SuncorpGrads Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgPZg9 posted 2025-Aug-1, 4:28 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPZg9 posted 2025-Aug-1, 4:28 pm AEST O.P. Hi everyone! We have opened applications today for our next intakes of interns and graduates across Australia and New Zealand. We have approximately 50 roles in our graduate program across a number of streams (Insurance, Data Science/Analytics, Technology, Underwriting, HR, Finance, Risk, etc.). These roles are spread across Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Perth & Auckland, and you can find out what locations each stream is considering on our graduate ads. The 2026 graduate program will commence at the end of January, and you must have graduated in the past two years or be finished studying by the time the program commences to be eligible. Our intern program is predominantly in our Technology stream, and we have approximately 30 placements across Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. The internship commences late November and runs through to February with two weeks off over Christmas (10 weeks total). This is a paid internship, and you must be penultimate year of university to be eligible. If you do have any questions, we're happy to answer what we can and will try our best to regularly monitor this thread. More information about the roles and how to apply are on our website now at www.suncorpgroup.com.au/careers/graduates

content: User #646401 273 posts SuncorpGrads Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgP295 posted 2025-Aug-5, 2:37 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP295 posted 2025-Aug-5, 2:37 pm AEST O.P. @matchamuch Our preference is to run in person interviews/assessment centres this year, and we'll aim for this approach where possible.

thread_title: Suncorp Group 2026 Graduate & 2025 Intern Programs -  Graduate programs
author: SuncorpGrads
content: User #646401 273 posts SuncorpGrads Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgP3ab posted 2025-Aug-5, 2:39 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP3ab posted 2025-Aug-5, 2:39 pm AEST O.P. @AmyBree unfortunately not, the roles/streams listed on our career site and ads are the positions we have available for next year.

thread_title: Suncorp Group 2026 Graduate & 2025 Intern Programs -  Graduate programs
author: SuncorpGrads
content: User #646401 273 posts SuncorpGrads Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgP3aO posted 2025-Aug-5, 2:52 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP3aO posted 2025-Aug-5, 2:52 pm AEST O.P. @hippidydoo If you are interested in multiple streams, please submit your application against each so our team are aware and can consider you for all of them. You only have to complete online testing once though, so after your first application is submitted, if you complete the assessment first before applying for the additional streams your results will automatically pull through to the others. If you apply for multiple streams before completing the testing, there isn't an issue with this, we can manually pull through your results in the system on our end.

content: User #646401 273 posts SuncorpGrads Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgP6jD posted 2025-Aug-8, 3:58 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP6jD posted 2025-Aug-8, 3:58 pm AEST O.P. @nojobgrad yes students on 485 visas can apply so long as your visa does not expire during the two-year program. We should also mention that Suncorp does not offer visa sponsorship post your 485-visa ending, so it is your responsibility to ensure you can continue to work at Suncorp beyond the visa expiry date by exploring alternative visa options.

thread_title: 2026 Aus Government Graduate Program Legal Stream -  Graduate programs
author: Big Poppa Flex
content: User #932949 2 posts Big Poppa Flex I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOvVX posted 2025-May-3, 10:32 am AEST edited 2025-May-3, 10:36 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOvVX posted 2025-May-3, 10:32 am AEST (edited 2025-May-3, 10:36 am AEST) The written assessment was hard. What was asked in the activity was pretty straightforward. But having to read the facts and law and write all the issues they wanted me to address was not easy. Also add the fact that there is no spell check (the first screen warned if you change windows the assessment would freeze, so can't type in word) and the timer is invisible because the text box needs scrolling the timer off view. Scrolling back and forth to timer adds a few seconds because of the amount of text you have to scroll past. And the text box only shows 2 lines at a time. But at least you can copy from the facts/law and paste it if you have to.

content: User #934332 5 posts leospaceman I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPI9i posted 2025-Jul-17, 12:50 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPI9i posted 2025-Jul-17, 12:50 pm AEST Anybody able to provide insights about how the preferencing system works? Is it: a) all first preferences get sent to the agencies, who then pick their grads. Then 2nd, 3rd etc preferences are staggered in rounds until all roles are filled?; b) top 5 preferences are sent to respective agencies, who make offers to you if they like you; or c) some variation I haven’t thought of. Would rather get something in hand even if not my ideal dept, rather than preference the most competitive ones and then end up with nothing – as I know some candidates have had happen to them in the past.

thread_title: 2026 Aus Government Graduate Program Legal Stream -  Graduate programs
author: leospaceman
content: User #934332 5 posts leospaceman I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgP3dj posted 2025-Aug-5, 3:35 pm AEST edited 2025-Aug-5, 3:41 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP3dj posted 2025-Aug-5, 3:35 pm AEST (edited 2025-Aug-5, 3:41 pm AEST) Hey mate, per merit pool email 16.07.25: Should you be successfully matched to a participating agency, you will be contacted by them directly from mid-August onwards to confirm your interest in taking up a graduate role in 2026. Question: Does anyone know of people who were merit pooled but not matched? Or rough percentages? Edit: may have answered my question. Data stream says ‘Last year, more than 200 candidates out of 500 who made it to the merit pool did not receive any job offers’. The HR person on the thread said similar proportions are seen across streams. I think it would be in one’s best interests to keep applying elsewhere, just in case.

thread_title: 2026 Aus Government Graduate Program Legal Stream -  Graduate programs
author: staticdesign
content: User #928251 70 posts staticdesign Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgP3fg posted 2025-Aug-5, 4:07 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP3fg posted 2025-Aug-5, 4:07 pm AEST FYI, there is a FOI request regarding the 2024/25 AGGP – Legal Stream which provides insight into the numbers re preferencing and MP ( https://www.ag.gov.au/sites/ default/files/2024-10/FOI24- 411%20-%20Disclosure%20log%2 0documents%20-%20date%20of%20access%20031024.PDF ). On page 79 of the PDF, it says there were 278 and 241 candidates in the Merit Pool for the 2024 and 2025 graduate programs, respectively.

author: billthekrill
content: User #933065 10 posts billthekrill I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOV1f posted 2025-May-27, 6:20 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOV1f posted 2025-May-27, 6:20 pm AEST For people who got through the STEM stream OA, what approach did you take? I've never had to answer questions like that before, and honestly don't know what they were looking for. Since they said they wouldn't provide feedback, I was hoping I could pick your brains in case I do one of those again. For the email questions, I tried as much as possible to write an email that I thought would be similar to something you would actually send on the job. Were you especially enthusiastic? Did you try to add details to the scenarios? Any info would be much appreciated.

author: aidenh37
content: User #637085 721 posts aidenh37 Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgOWmi posted 2025-May-28, 8:30 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOWmi posted 2025-May-28, 8:30 am AEST billthekrill writes... Any info would be much appreciated. While I didn't even get through 2 out of the 4, I think they were looking for the right balance in detail. Took me a bit to warm up but had good flow by the time the time was up. I'm hoping that speed wasn't a factor in their assessment of the responses. The task, like with Services Australia, is much better than the typical OA because it actually gives you an idea of what you might do in the Department if successful. Obviously the graduate program is for more than just the Department of Industry, but they're the ones running it so it makes sense. Overall a decent assessment of how one would respond in the workplace, I think.

author: inneedofajob
content: User #933046 32 posts inneedofajob Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgPlOO posted 2025-Jun-24, 1:18 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPlOO posted 2025-Jun-24, 1:18 pm AEST The process for generalist and digital stream can be seen in this link: https://content.apsjobs.gov.a u/career-pathways/graduate-programs/generalist-stream Ctrl+f "Application Process" In short: Submit resume and written pitch Do aptitute test if successful, written pitch is assessed if successful, one-way video interview, recording yourself answering questions. if successful, placed into merit pool Hope that an agency picks you out of the merit pool

author: potato66066
content: User #932391 29 posts potato66066 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPneV posted 2025-Jun-25, 11:24 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPneV posted 2025-Jun-25, 11:24 pm AEST Seems like not everyone who made it into the merit pool had their supervisors get sent the form. I would assume the ones who had received the form are considered for a role, but what's the point of the rest of us being in the merit pool if they already know who to contact since day 1 of the merit pool release?

author: juliett-foxtrot
content: User #933052 107 posts juliett-foxtrot Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgPnfm posted 2025-Jun-25, 11:44 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPnfm posted 2025-Jun-25, 11:44 pm AEST The point of the merit pool is that you're deemed suitable however may have been just outside of the first rounds. If people have multiple offers and choose to decline the spot for this program, then a spot opens up for another person on the merit list. They could also be contacting referees in batches, so I wouldn't read into it if you've been merit pooled but your reference hasn't been contacted yet.

author: Dashing20088t
content: User #934212 10 posts Dashing20088t I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPrR3 posted 2025-Jul-1, 12:25 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPrR3 posted 2025-Jul-1, 12:25 pm AEST +1 rejection Just wondering if anyone can at all help out as I’m really confused?! I’ve just received this email - Thank you for your application for 2026 AFP Graduate Program, reference number …. Unfortunately, the details provided in your application have not met the AFP minimum requirements for 2026 AFP Graduate Program, and on this instance your application has been withdrawn from our recruitment process. You are eligible to reapply for positions within AFP after 31/01/2027. Further information on the broader AFP minimum eligibility requirements can be found on our website. Eligibility requirements related specifically to the role can be located on each job advertisement. Kind Regards AFP Recruitment. I’m so confused as I don’t know how I didn’t pass through the ESQ? author: brazy
content: User #934126 32 posts brazy I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgQbbg posted 2025-Aug-14, 10:15 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgQbbg posted 2025-Aug-14, 10:15 am AEST +1 Merit Pool Very shocked too, but does this mean we will get offers in the coming weeks or is this like the 'backup', wherein offers have been made and if someone else backs out then people from the merit pool get offers?

author: bsecllbgrad24
content: User #933434 6 posts bsecllbgrad24 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgQbb5 posted 2025-Aug-14, 10:29 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgQbb5 posted 2025-Aug-14, 10:29 am AEST From what I understand, everyone placed in the merit pool has successfully passed all stages of the recruitment process. In the coming weeks, business areas within the AFP will begin contacting candidates to discuss potential roles within the Graduate Program. Based on those discussions, formal offers will be issued. However, I believe that more candidates have been placed in the merit pool than there are immediate graduate positions available (I think it is something like 30 positions available). So while being in the merit pool is a strong outcome, it doesn’t guarantee an offer. If you don’t receive a graduate offer, your details remain in the merit pool for 12 months. During that time, other AFP business areas (e.g. those outside the Graduate Program) can access your application and assessment results. If your experience aligns with a vacancy they’re trying to fill, they may reach out to discuss the opportunity and potentially offer you a role. Hope that makes sense :)

author: milk-boy-dude
content: User #927051 83 posts milk-boy-dude Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgNkK1 posted 2025-Feb-21, 1:17 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNkK1 posted 2025-Feb-21, 1:17 pm AEST O.P. just behavioural and motivational questions. it would be unfair to other people if we shared the questions. only tips i can give you is prepare some STAR questions and answers and do as many practice questions before answering the actual questions.

author: unknownvirus
content: User #925454 126 posts unknownvirus Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgNk2G posted 2025-Feb-21, 5:02 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNk2G posted 2025-Feb-21, 5:02 pm AEST My VI invite took about 2-3 hours after finishing OA

author: milk-boy-dude
content: User #927051 83 posts milk-boy-dude Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgNk7t posted 2025-Feb-21, 6:18 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNk7t posted 2025-Feb-21, 6:18 pm AEST O.P. usually they start inviting people to the AC a week or two after the applications close. so basically after the VI, it's just a waiting game. it's all automated so they dont even look at ur VI's. they use AI to just rank it and cherry pick from there with the OA results as a backup.

content: User #913332 279 posts Ashen_Chevalier Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgNnZE posted 2025-Feb-24, 7:44 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNnZE posted 2025-Feb-24, 7:44 pm AEST I did the assessment and then got a VI invite around 2 hours later. author: JamesC47
content: User #921669 53 posts JamesC47 Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgNn6R posted 2025-Feb-24, 10:22 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNn6R posted 2025-Feb-24, 10:22 pm AEST Or they use the auto-test, or a combination of auto-test and AI. You would be kind of silly not to actually watch the top x% that you actually interview cause the actual interview is much more time consuming than watching a VI and if you can filter out some people early who are good at fooling the AI but not much else that's a win.

author: rayzi
content: User #923684 6 posts rayzi I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgNDXq posted 2025-Mar-10, 2:17 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNDXq posted 2025-Mar-10, 2:17 pm AEST current grad here, no not really – the only ones that have the potential to move into SWE roles are data science and cybersec. I would recommend emailing HR and asking if they can confirm your stream for you and potentially switch you over – if they can’t you might have to re-apply. Statistically the accounting/finance streams are a lot more competitive too because there are a lot less roles available so i’d recommend shooting them an email just to be safe

author: ChubbyFox
content: User #925043 46 posts ChubbyFox Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgN0CX posted 2025-Apr-1, 5:33 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgN0CX posted 2025-Apr-1, 5:33 pm AEST From previous years' experience, they usually only send bulk rejection emails to people ranked at the bottom. Those who rank the highest get invited straight away, while people in the middle are placed on a waitlist. If someone declines their AC invite, waitlisted candidates might be contacted. So if you haven’t received a rejection email yet, there’s still hope! Last year one of my friends actually got this invite just one day before the AC through a phone call :) They usually send out final rejection emails after all AC sessions are done

content: User #927051 83 posts milk-boy-dude Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgOaTv posted 2025-Apr-11, 8:39 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOaTv posted 2025-Apr-11, 8:39 pm AEST O.P. yeah, i get why its hard sharing rejections. i think its also good to share rejections that way people can give advice so next time they can do better. thanks for that @ediblesponge22 the lady said my answer to a risk question was too vague, hence the rejection.

author: sounds_about_wrong
content: User #932457 1 posts sounds_about_wrong I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOaV9 posted 2025-Apr-11, 9:08 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOaV9 posted 2025-Apr-11, 9:08 pm AEST I made a Whirlpool account just for this: +1 Verbal Rejection for Engineering in Sydney AC was on Monday, April 7 Call was at 12:40pm on Thursday, April 10 My camera stopped working during the individual interviews and as such they were unable to tell if I was reading off of a script. I also did not go into enough depth for the R in STAR for several questions. The recruiter told me that only 20/64 candidates will receive an offer for Engineering in Sydney. I have also heard from someone else that only 12/32 will receive an offer for Cyber in Sydney. Up until now I’ve always been under the impression that AC pass rates were very high, but I suppose things are different this year. It sounds like the 2026 grad intake will be much smaller than 2025’s.

author: nuhuh

It might also be that they are going to have more rounds later, hence don't want to put all their eggs in one basket

I also thought the pass rates were high so this is surprising indeed. I'm guessing that the Melbourne engineering intakes are even lower than Sydney's.

content: User #927051 83 posts milk-boy-dude Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgOaWB posted 2025-Apr-11, 9:19 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOaWB posted 2025-Apr-11, 9:19 pm AEST O.P. thanks for the insight. ive been feeling a bit off from the rejection because i thought the success rate was high, seems i heard it wrong. feel a bit of relief. its a shame a technical problem contributed to your rejection though. maybe intake this year is a bit less than last year. hopefully they open for a second round so we get another shot. good luck mid year!

author: OfflineGrad
content: User #931792 11 posts OfflineGrad I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOa0a posted 2025-Apr-11, 10:19 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOa0a posted 2025-Apr-11, 10:19 pm AEST A bit bummed but just gotta keep going

author: GlobalTourist
content: User #919674 93 posts GlobalTourist Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgOa2h posted 2025-Apr-11, 11:36 pm AEST edited 2025-Apr-11, 11:54 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOa2h posted 2025-Apr-11, 11:36 pm AEST (edited 2025-Apr-11, 11:54 pm AEST) CBA is the only bank that still hires graduates in large batches, particularly in tech. ANZ has completely cut off its tech graduate intake as it is shifting tech operations to India, only recruiting graduates for client-facing roles. NAB and Westpac seem even less inclined to invest directly in graduates, opting instead to prioritise offering return opportunities to interns, leaving fewer headcount to graduates. Tough market, getting rejected doesn’t mean you aren’t good enough. It’s chaos and becoming somewhat a game of luck.

author: conflicted
content: User #932278 37 posts conflicted Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgObJe posted 2025-Apr-12, 10:23 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgObJe posted 2025-Apr-12, 10:23 pm AEST another in the loop email from cba..

author: ReyMysterio
content: User #922827 78 posts ReyMysterio Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgObOt posted 2025-Apr-13, 6:18 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgObOt posted 2025-Apr-13, 6:18 am AEST All I'm saying is I got rejected by cba and a bunch of other grad role but got a role at okta in security role straight after graduating. I know it can be demoralising but do not take it personally. You cannot give up. Keep applying and keep networking. Because nepotism is real and in cyber especially everyone knows everyone. So they do give special treatment.

content: User #934773 3 posts patbateman I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgP2be posted 2025-Aug-4, 3:37 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP2be posted 2025-Aug-4, 3:37 pm AEST would also like to know

author: changi22
content: User #926200 8 posts changi22 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgP2m7 posted 2025-Aug-4, 6:54 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP2m7 posted 2025-Aug-4, 6:54 pm AEST Go the Hirevue 'Your Insights' page and Inspect Element (i.e. press F12). Click on the 'Network' tab and refresh the page. Filter for 'graphql' in the filter box at the top so that you can only see graphql requests. Left-click on the 3rd-last or the last 'graphql' thing and on the right-hand side, you should see a response tab open up with scores from 1-5 for the different capabilities.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgMXOA posted 2025-Jan-30, 8:44 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgMXOA posted 2025-Jan-30, 8:44 am AEST O.P. The Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) is managing the recruitment of data graduates on behalf of the Australian Government. So far, around 40 Australian Government and Commonwealth departments and agencies are participating in this program. This means applicants only need to submit one job application to have access to work in lots of different agencies. Some data roles we will be recruiting for include Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Mathematician/Statisticians, Data Engineers, Data Managers and Geospatial Specialists. Applications for the 2026 intake will open on 3 March 2025. Last year, we placed about 270 graduates across about 40 Government agencies, including the ABS. To be eligible to be a 2026 Australian Government Data Graduate you must: • be an Australian Citizen when you apply • will or have completed at least an Australian Qualifications Framework Level 7 qualification (a Bachelor degree) or higher equivalent by 31 December 2025 • your most recent eligible qualification has or will be completed between 1 January 2021 to 31 December 2025. If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you can post on this thread or contact the ABS Graduate Recruitment Team directly at recruitment@abs.gov.au . More information will be posted as it becomes available. Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgMZrx posted 2025-Jan-31, 1:05 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgMZrx posted 2025-Jan-31, 1:05 pm AEST O.P. Hi @WikiWill We are still working with Government agencies to confirm the number of positions available in 2026, so this information is not final yet but is currently sitting at about 220. As Craig mentioned, all government agencies require a security clearance and this is done prior to your commencement if you are offered a position. Interviews will be occurring in May and June and are done virtually. Hope that helps! Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

I am very interested in applying for this position but I am concerned that when it comes to providing references, I will only be able to provide a reference from my current HR manager. thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgNaHv posted 2025-Feb-11, 11:27 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNaHv posted 2025-Feb-11, 11:27 am AEST O.P. Hi @Downing Street 191 No, using your HR manager as your reference would not affect your application negatively. Ideally, you will nominate a work-related referee, that is, someone that you’ve reported to in a work environment. If you don’t have a work-related referee, you can contact a senior person from your university, for example a supervisor or university lecturer. Even if you are only able to get a reference from a HR manager, we would still encourage you to apply. Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgNxQc posted 2025-Mar-4, 2:15 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNxQc posted 2025-Mar-4, 2:15 pm AEST O.P. Hi @viznatflex, The Data Graduate program is a whole-of-Government program, not just the ABS. That means you only need to submit one application form which will then be considered for placement across the participating agencies (so not a separate application for each agency). With the streams, applicants must choose which stream they would like to apply for. You cannot apply for multiple streams. Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgNDMY posted 2025-Mar-10, 11:59 am AEST edited 2025-Mar-10, 12:06 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNDMY posted 2025-Mar-10, 11:59 am AEST (edited 2025-Mar-10, 12:06 pm AEST) O.P. Hi @Absolute-Data, the Graduate Certificate in Business Administration that you completed this month is eligible, as it’s an AQF level 8. Contact the ABS Recruitment team directly to talk about what to enter in the major field. @ sosmi12, it’s completely up to you to decide if you would like to apply for a position with other agencies. If unsure, have a read over the position being offered. Often, the agency will identify if they are hiring candidates from the Data Stream or another skillset. They may be participating in this program, rather than (or sometimes as well as) recruiting for roles specifically themselves. Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: ColonelHathi
content: User #924772 37 posts ColonelHathi Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgND2E posted 2025-Mar-10, 4:02 pm AEST edited 2025-Mar-10, 4:35 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgND2E posted 2025-Mar-10, 4:02 pm AEST (edited 2025-Mar-10, 4:35 pm AEST) Hi Everyone, Please do not be under any illusion that if you make it to the merit pool under this program, you are guaranteed a position. Last year, more than 200 candidates out of 500 who made it to the merit pool did not receive any job offers. It is in your best interest to apply as many departments as possible. Also apply for other streams such as STEM stream if possible. Please do not believe if anyone says "In previous years every candidate in the merit pool received at least one offer". That was not true for last year. My big advice would be not to choose "Mathematician/Statistician stream". Many ended up not getting an offer, if they did, it was under generalist stream. With upcoming federal election and Talk of american style DOGE, the uncertainty in the number of jobs will be higher. Goodluck.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgNEJF posted 2025-Mar-11, 11:54 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNEJF posted 2025-Mar-11, 11:54 am AEST O.P. Hi all, We do our best to provide transparent updates throughout the recruitment process including updates on the number of agencies and the number of vacancies. The number of vacancies varies each year and is also impacted by changes in candidate circumstances, such as withdrawals, and the locations of roles. Data from last year found that all streams had a similar proportion of offers made so we encourage you to apply for the stream that aligns most with your interest and qualifications. If you make the data stream merit pool you will be considered for placement by participating agencies. If you are interested in other streams or a specific agency, you are encouraged to apply for their processes too. All the best with your application! Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

author: Globe781
content: User #879090 9 posts Globe781 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgNWD2 posted 2025-Mar-28, 4:46 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNWD2 posted 2025-Mar-28, 4:46 am AEST Hi Bec, I'm interested in knowing if WAM/GPA is considered when choosing candidates? Also, if we really wanted to change our written answer, is the only option to withdraw and apply again? or is this not possible and we would be unable to apply again.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgNWNO posted 2025-Mar-28, 9:41 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgNWNO posted 2025-Mar-28, 9:41 am AEST O.P. Hi @viznatflex, There is no cap to the number of streams you can apply for. Each agency manages a different stream and we do not know which applicants have applied for multiple streams. If you were to apply for multiple streams, you could potentially be made multiple offers across multiple streams for you to consider. Hi @Globe781, We look at your application holistically in the recruitment process, this may include your performance in your studies. If you would like to change your written response please do not withdraw your application as you cannot resubmit it. I would suggest you call us on 1800 249 583 to ensure your application can be edited before the close date on Monday. If you email us on Monday, there is no guarantee we will get back to you before the job closes. Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

I just submitted my application without uploading my overseas qualification, since I didn't expect it to be assessed in time by Skilled and Business Migration. Shortly after submitting, the assessment of the qualification came through! Now I'm wondering whether I should withdraw and resubmit my application with the new information? I left the field where one can upload a foreign degree blank, since the text above it seemed to imply one can submit that information at a later date – is that correct? Thank you!

author: _Jakem_
content: User #932719 1 posts _Jakem_ I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOk9c posted 2025-Apr-23, 9:05 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOk9c posted 2025-Apr-23, 9:05 pm AEST Hello all, Just wanted to provide some information some might find useful for finding the My Forms page. Start by visiting the ABS careers site. You can then navigate to 'Current vacancies' in the left side menu or by scrolling down. Doing so will bring you to the current jobs list. Looking top right, you should see the login button alongside the 'Help' button. Log in and the profile button should appear where the login button once was. Hope it all goes smoothly for everyone doing the assessment over the coming week and best of luck to everybody! P.S. I would normally provide a direct link but I am unsure of the security requirements of this forum :)

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgOAIa posted 2025-May-7, 3:07 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOAIa posted 2025-May-7, 3:07 pm AEST O.P. @hangaag, candidates were not asked for references in their application. Following interviews, suitable candidates will be contacted with further information at the reference check stage. @xx, there will be two panel members at each interview from any of the participating agencies. @Des0004, we received over 2300 applications this year. We are still working with Government agencies to confirm the number of positions available in 2026, so this information is not final yet but is currently sitting at about 220. Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

author: leitpg
content: User #932680 84 posts leitpg Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgOB5L posted 2025-May-8, 9:27 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOB5L posted 2025-May-8, 9:27 pm AEST Hi Bec, I noticed that the status of most interview slots before 28 May has changed from "Slot Full" to "Closed." Just wondering—does this mean those slots have been cancelled, or are the people who selected them simply no longer able to make changes? Thanks in advance for your help!

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgOCyf posted 2025-May-9, 12:26 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOCyf posted 2025-May-9, 12:26 pm AEST O.P. Hi all, @inneedofajob, only candidates that achieved a certain score were progressed, this score was not 100%. @xx, you will not be notified who the panel members are prior to interview. @hhen, we are aiming to notify candidates if they have progressed to Reference Checks by mid-June. It is a good idea to reach out to your referee and check their availability around that time. @leitpg, if the status reads 'Closed' that means all the time slots have been taken and the time to book in has passed. If you would like to reschedule your interview please reach out to our team on recruitment@abs.gov.au .

author: rephrasing
content: User #932587 171 posts rephrasing Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgOCEm posted 2025-May-9, 1:59 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOCEm posted 2025-May-9, 1:59 pm AEST partyflix writes... my suspicion is that it does Is this not a merit pool application process...? So I assume you'll need an average of x score across the board...? Again, not 100% sure, but I think this is how it has worked previously.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: juliett-foxtrot
content: User #933052 107 posts juliett-foxtrot Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgOCGc posted 2025-May-9, 2:25 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOCGc posted 2025-May-9, 2:25 pm AEST From memory the interview is to determine whether you get into the merit pool and then if you make it there you put preferences for agencies and locations. Then offers will be in rounds. The goal is to match the grads that suit each agency best, so I don't think it's a first come first served type thing. I applied and was matched for last year's program but due to personal circumstances I had to pull out and am reapplying this year. So unless its changed since then, this should be mostly accurate. Bec can correct me if im wrong. Hope this helps ease your worries about interview timing though.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgOCKJ posted 2025-May-9, 3:39 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOCKJ posted 2025-May-9, 3:39 pm AEST O.P. @leitpg, no the timing and date of the interview has no impact on your outcome. Candidates that are found suitable at interview will progress to the Reference Check stage but no offers will be made at this point. As mentioned above, offers will be made in rounds at a later date after the merit pool has been finalised. Hope that helps! Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Skewness
content: User #932864 11 posts Skewness I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOIYw posted 2025-May-16, 11:44 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOIYw posted 2025-May-16, 11:44 am AEST Hi all, Unfortunately was rejected from the Data Science stream based on the skills assessment this year. It’s clear that I need to strengthen my ML skills if I want to reapply next year (which I am very keen to do). Does anyone have any tips for self-guided learning on this topic? Currently reading Applied Predictive Modelling by Johnson and Kuhn. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated :)

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: gotit
content: User #928423 33 posts gotit Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgOIZH posted 2025-May-16, 11:58 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOIZH posted 2025-May-16, 11:58 am AEST @Skewness Sorry about that. The good thing is, you have identified the gaps and keen to work on them. I think this book is good: Machine Learning with Pytorch and Scikit-Learn by Sebastian Raschka and others. That said, I am not sure at this stage they are looking for some solid knowledge of ML concepts. Just the fundamentals is okay. You can look at this one too: Introduction to Data Mining by Vipin Kumar and others. Note: Most of the time, you need to get your hands dirty. Build stuff!

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: rephrasing
content: User #932587 171 posts rephrasing Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgOI5k posted 2025-May-16, 1:22 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOI5k posted 2025-May-16, 1:22 pm AEST Skewness writes... strengthen my ML skills Was literally about to say this: gotit writes... Note: Most of the time, you need to get your hands dirty. Build stuff! Doing is the best way to learn (Initially atleast). Follow some tutorials, learn how they work, why they work, and then apply it. I have been doing some myself alongside my Soft Dev skills, and it is so rewarding when you can get a model to do what you want haha. Good luck :)

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgO2EL posted 2025-Jun-3, 3:29 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgO2EL posted 2025-Jun-3, 3:29 pm AEST O.P. Hi, @araa, we will be seeking one reference. @cscX, the reference check stage forms part of the selection process and contributes to the outcome decision. If a candidate is placed in the merit pool, their referee report will form part of the resources that agencies can review before making an offer. More information about reference checks will be provided in the email to those that are progressing. Hope that helps! Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

author: AGNL
content: User #934043 1 posts AGNL I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPjAV posted 2025-Jun-21, 7:32 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPjAV posted 2025-Jun-21, 7:32 pm AEST +1 rejection for data generalist. @Jyudie same here, I was also in the pool last year but not offered anywhere within the grad program. I did personally end up getting offered a non-ongoing position in APS because they needed someone fast and I was in the merit pool in the right city, but since that position ends in Nov, I was hoping to secure a grad position for next year. Just figured I'd share so people know that it is still possible (albeit definitely quite unlikely) to get offered something even once the grad program selection rounds finish. I guess onwards and upwards, and good luck to everyone else with getting somewhere.

author: Tiv44
content: User #934085 1 posts Tiv44 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPlgI posted 2025-Jun-23, 7:10 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPlgI posted 2025-Jun-23, 7:10 pm AEST Hi @Bec_ABS I wanted to know about the cut off being to graduate by 31st December. Is there any way for someone who will officially finish their degree by February to be granted flexibility in their application? Will it depend on the host agency/department? Thanks.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgPlEy posted 2025-Jun-24, 10:21 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPlEy posted 2025-Jun-24, 10:21 am AEST O.P. Hi, @Jyudie, please email us via recruitment@abs.gov.au to discuss. @starapple, please nominate a work-related referee, such as a supervisor, manager, or someone you’ve reported to in a professional setting. Ideally you would have worked with your referee within the last 2 years so they can easily recount their experience. @dduc, a written reference could be typed or hand-written, either is fine. @leitpg, candidates are not scored lower based on their graduation date or if they have been in a merit pool prior (this process is completely independent of last year's selection process). @avgconsultant, generally we do not conduct phone interviews with references. However we may contact your referee directly if further clarification is needed. @Tiv44, no the eligibility criteria requires graduates to have completed their degree by 31 December. Contact us at recruitment@abs.gov.au to discuss your situation further. The Q&A Hub has been updated with our FAQs so please take a look there for further information. Bec – Graduate Recruitment Manager

content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgPnCR posted 2025-Jun-26, 12:49 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPnCR posted 2025-Jun-26, 12:49 pm AEST O.P. Hi @Orangefarmer, Candidates can expect to hear from us around mid July with their outcome and this is when the merit pool will be confirmed. Following candidates submitting their preferences and agencies consideration period, offers will be made to candidates in mid August. Dates are tentative but we are aiming to notify candidates as soon as possible. We are still in the midst of the selection process so we are not able to share the number of candidates that will be in the merit pool yet. Bec – Graduate Recruitment Manager

author: hav0c
content: User #933225 20 posts hav0c I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPn5f posted 2025-Jun-26, 8:35 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPn5f posted 2025-Jun-26, 8:35 pm AEST Hi Bec , I just wanted confirmation about something. I completed my undergrad in January, 2021 and then worked for 3 years in a somewhat related but different industry to data analysis, I then joined my postgrad degree Masters in a Data Science field in Feb of 2024 expecting to graduate by Dec 2025. I’ve done everything but my thesis and 2 elective subjects (to be done next sem) but have got an offer for 6-month job contract so I’m contemplating exiting with an early exit (grad diploma) this semester rather than pushing on with the masters {In my application though I did state I was doing a master (AQF level-9) and would be a recent grad in that by the time feb,2026 comes around}. If in merit pool and I exit with postgrad diploma (AQF-8) rather than the Master’s will there be any implications if matched with a grad offer? Just wanted to cover all bases before coming to a decision on whether to accept the contract and hence shorten my Masters or not.

(Or try and do both..), but I wouldn’t change up because you get (or might get) merit pooled.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgPr7H posted 2025-Jul-1, 3:50 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPr7H posted 2025-Jul-1, 3:50 pm AEST O.P. Hi all, @potato66066, the merit pool is unranked. More information explaining how merit pools work will be provided shortly. @leitpg, if you have used your preferred/English name on your application then we will be able to identify that you are the same person. If you have added a note to the comments section, that is sufficient. @data_downunder, the APS level offered as a Data Graduate depends on the agency however this detail will be included in the Agency Guide (see below). Security clearances are required to be completed in time for graduates to commence, however this may be up to the agency discretion and individual circumstances. @Orangefarmer, candidates that are found suitable will be provided with a comprehensive Agency Guide that details the agency salary, locations, what the agency offers etc. This will be provided to candidates that are placed in the merit pool when they are notified of the outcome. We are not able to provide a stream specific breakdown at this stage. @hhen, we will update on this figure when we can. @Data enthusiastic, yes once you have uploaded your Reference Report and the due date has passed, it is no longer available to be edited or re-uploaded. Hope that helps! Bec – Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgPDrr posted 2025-Jul-11, 9:03 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPDrr posted 2025-Jul-11, 9:03 am AEST O.P. Good morning, to wrap up the recent questions; @stanaespa, candidates have been rated suitable for the merit pool. Now it's up to agencies to decide who they offer a position to. The FAQ document released provides more info about the Placements Stage. @Random_user, only select a location if you are willing to accept an offer and live there. @Orangefarmer, the number of available positions is still sitting at about 220, but this may fluctuate. There are about 320 people in the merit pool. With the salaries, each agency has it's own process. On “commencement” means when a candidate starts with the agency. On “advancement” may mean when the candidate successfully completes their development program and passes probation. But you can contact the agency to confirm what their criteria are. @hav0c, Services Australia is participating in this program which means they will engage candidates from the Data Stream. If they are running their own graduate process then that is separate and we have no information about that. We can only provide information on the Data Stream. I encourage you to give them a call to talk about your options. @troja5, in the preference form candidates are asked if they consent to us sharing their information with other agencies outside of their Top 3 for consideration for a job offer. This could be because agencies are seeking someone with a specific qualification or location preference for example. @hav0c, that’s correct, the merit pool is unranked. Each agency determines who to offer to to meet their needs. They may look at the candidate agency and location preferences, their qualifications, performance in the selection process, reference etc. @rephrasing, to clarify, currently there are 33 different agencies, not streams. We are not releasing info about how many positions per agency. Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgPHcy posted 2025-Jul-15, 11:50 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPHcy posted 2025-Jul-15, 11:50 am AEST O.P. Hi all, To answer some of the recent questions (that haven't already been answered): @user1909 – There are multiple rounds of offers so if you don't receive an offer immediately, you will still be in the merit pool and could receive an offer later in the year. @potato66066 – Potentially the number of roles could decrease (or increase), this is dependent on each agencies demand. @data_downunder – The Agency Guide is a summary of key information and should help to inform your decisions. If you have particular questions about one of the agencies, feel free to contact them directly. Preferences are due on Wednesday and if you do not submit your preferences by the due date, we will be unable to consider you in Round One. @Random_user – Rotations are a key component of some graduate program to provide graduates with further networking opportunities and expand their skills in other areas within the business. For some candidates, having rotations is a selling point but this is personal preference. @Arielxx – Please refer to our FAQs for answers to your first questions. If you would like to change your preferences due to a change in circumstances, please contact our team. @araa – An unofficial university transcript is sufficient while you have not completed your degree. The email refers to commencement procedures so the transcript is only required once you have been made an offer and started onboarding with your agency, a transcript is not required at the preference stage. @Hmbased – Candidate preferences will not be collected again, so keep this in mind when submitting. As previously mentioned, we are not releasing info about how many positions per agency. @Random_user – Most agencies offer some relocation support however what this includes varies. @leitpg – Each agency has it's own pre-engagement checks, so please contact the agency directly if you have questions about their process. Bec – ABS Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: potato66066
content: User #932391 29 posts potato66066 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPHP6 posted 2025-Jul-16, 12:35 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPHP6 posted 2025-Jul-16, 12:35 am AEST I'm fairly certain the 220 is only for the AGGP data stream, as previously mentioned, because the ABS is unaware of the recruitment processes of other agencies and what they know is the number of grads the other agencies participating in the program tell them they want. There is no reason for the agencies to tell the ABS they want a certain number and then tell you another number when you email them. My advice is not to worry about whether the 220 is actually 220 or not, because it's just going to stress you out more if you keep thinking about it. Nothing is really going to change at either conclusion because, at the end of the day, you either get an offer or don't get an offer at the end of this.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgPH0Z posted 2025-Jul-16, 9:52 am AEST edited 2025-Jul-16, 2:13 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPH0Z posted 2025-Jul-16, 9:52 am AEST (edited 2025-Jul-16, 2:13 pm AEST) O.P. Hi all, We understand that submitting preferences is a lot to think about. I can confirm that at the moment there is demand for 220 Data Graduates across all our participating agencies and this is based on information provided by each agency. @leitpg – No, candidate preferences will not be collected again. If your top three agencies fill their positions in Round 1, we will send candidates to other agencies for consideration. @crazychu – Many agencies (such as NDIA) are flexible so they are open to taking on graduates across a number of locations. For example, if their preferred candidate is based in Melbourne, they may offer them a Melbourne role and if another candidate is based in Perth, then they may make them an offer in Perth. Advertising multiple locations does not mean they have a role in each location. @data_downunder – Yes candidates may be considered by other agencies from the first round. @juliett-foxtrot – Offers in Round 1 may come from your Top 3 preferred agencies or another agency if you gave permission in your preferences form. @leitpg – This question has been answered previously. The demand of 220 is for the AGGP Data Stream, we do not recruit for other agencies outside of the AGGP. Bec – Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: juliett-foxtrot
content: User #933052 107 posts juliett-foxtrot Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgPIkw posted 2025-Jul-16, 3:20 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPIkw posted 2025-Jul-16, 3:20 pm AEST Thanks for the information Bec! I was struggling to narrow it down as I know I'd be happy at almost all of the agencies, so didn't want to be closing myself off based on my top 3. With this, is it possible for some applicants to get multiple offers in round 1 or is it limited to one offer per person? Good luck to everyone! The waiting between now and the 8th is going to feel like forever!

author: rippled
content: User #848221 269 posts rippled Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgPYZn posted 2025-Aug-1, 12:06 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPYZn posted 2025-Aug-1, 12:06 pm AEST Hi @Bec_ABS, Could you please confirm whether the Merit Pool will remain active for 18 months? Thank you!

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgPY0D posted 2025-Aug-1, 12:27 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPY0D posted 2025-Aug-1, 12:27 pm AEST O.P. Hi all, @Benlawrie, it is likely that offers will go out at the earliest on Friday 8 August. Also, receiving a call from an agency is not indicative of whether you receive an offer. Within agencies, some teams may prefer to call candidates to decide who they will make an offer to, while another team within the same agency will make their offers without contacting candidates via phone. @rippled, yes the merit pool will remain active for 18 months. I hope that helps! Bec – Graduate Recruitment Manager

Hi all, To answer some of the questions: @hav0c – After Round 2 we will provide an update on available vacancies. Candidate preferences will not be collected again. @avdotya – Some candidates may have received an offer from an agency outside of their preferences, this is not an error. @Random_user – Correct, once you accept an offer you will be considered 'placed' in that agency and will no longer be considered for other offers. @Teacherghost – Agencies are not making calls today so this would not be from the AGGP. All offers are sent from the ABS via email. Hope that helps! Bec – Graduate Recruitment Manager

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: ColonelHathi
content: User #924772 37 posts ColonelHathi Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgP64E posted 2025-Aug-9, 1:04 pm AEST edited 2025-Aug-9, 1:16 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP64E posted 2025-Aug-9, 1:04 pm AEST (edited 2025-Aug-9, 1:16 pm AEST) Hi @sesame16, I am a last year candidate, based on my experience from last year, No one from Mathematician/Statistician stream claimed to have secured a job in that stream, You are free to apply to Agencies which do not have Mathematician/Statistician stream. I was in your situation as well but I got my only offer through generalist stream. I was not offered any job through Mathematician/Statistician stream. I believe, you are asking this question a bit late. You should have asked before the first round. Agencies consider Mathematician/Statistician stream for a generalist stream but not vice versa. Sorry, to break the bad news. The competition for Mathematician/Statistician stream is very high, you are probably competing against candidates with Phd's. If you look at the tab1 of this forum, I did warn about this problem for Mathematician/Statistician stream. Good luck.

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgP8pO posted 2025-Aug-11, 9:00 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP8pO posted 2025-Aug-11, 9:00 am AEST O.P. Good morning, there’s been a lot of great discussion and curiosity around Round 1 offers, so rather than respond to each question individually, I wanted to provide a general update to help clarify where things are at. - Round 1 offers went out on Friday. If you received and accepted an offer, congratulations! We’ll be in touch again after the acceptance deadline to let you know what happens next. - There are about 320 people in the merit pool, and only a small number are active in this thread. That means the conversations here—while helpful—don’t always reflect the full picture. So let me clarify. More than 30 agencies made offers in Round 1, across all three streams (Generalist/Scientist/Mathematician/Statistician), and in nearly all locations. - As mentioned by sesame16, and by us throughout the recruitment process, the majority of roles are for the Generalist stream, followed by Scientists, and then Mathematicians/Statisticians. - If you didn’t receive an offer in Round 1, you’re still in the running. You’ll move into Round 2, which we expect to begin around 28 August. At this stage, we anticipate most Round 2 offers will be made around the same time, but that could change and we’ll share more details closer to that date. - It’s still too early to confirm whether any new agencies will participate in later rounds, but we’ll keep you updated as we know more. Finally, if you have specific questions about your individual situation, the best way to get accurate information is to contact us directly. We’re happy to help. Thanks again for your patience and engagement— we know it can be a bit of a waiting game, and we really do appreciate your interest and the way you’ve been engaging with the process. Bec – Graduate Recruitment Manager

The percentage of people received offer in round 1 2. How many people are still in the merit pool & how many positions are remaining (Last year, after round 1 position has been decreased by 250, but the MP only decreased by 200, which looks fishy) 3. Anything we need to do before round 2. Thanks in advance!

thread_title: 2026 Australian Government Data Graduates -  Graduate programs
author: Bec_ABS
content: User #489974 528 posts Bec_ABS Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgP9F1 posted 2025-Aug-12, 3:11 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP9F1 posted 2025-Aug-12, 3:11 pm AEST O.P. Hi all, @leitpg – We will keep candidates updated with information as we approach Round 2. @GradDS26 – I can confirm offers from both of these agencies have been made in Brisbane. @Hezza1099 – Agencies consider all candidates that preferenced their agency regardless of streams, however which stream they decide to offer is up to the agency. All streams get equal opportunity to be considered by agencies. Hope that helps! Bec – Graduate Recruitment Manager

author: Icandoitt
content: User #926664 13 posts Icandoitt I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPGL7 posted 2025-Jul-14, 10:23 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPGL7 posted 2025-Jul-14, 10:23 pm AEST Hi future grads!! From my case last year: It took 2 months for each round. I had the offer in late October. Written assessments had 2 parts and 2 questions. Technical stream will have a different technical assessment. And Interview was not too tough, it was more like an open conversation to discuss about your strength, weakness (dont forget about Star Technique)

author: austrade-admin
content: User #934240 1 posts austrade-admin I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPtXG posted 2025-Jul-2, 1:55 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPtXG posted 2025-Jul-2, 1:55 pm AEST O.P. Austrade is looking for the next generation of leaders. Austrade is on the hunt for the next generation of leaders and changemakers to help drive Australia’s economic prosperity. As a graduate, you’ll kickstart a meaningful career in international trade and investment, helping to deliver on our government’s largest priorities – Australia’s transition to net zero and strengthening our economic resilience and security in today’s rapidly changing world. From day one, you’ll be part of a collaborative, outcomes-driven and culturally diverse team that values your unique voice and perspective. You’ll work alongside brilliant minds to power Australia’s future in sectors as unique as hydrogen, renewable energy, critical technology, defence, agribusiness and food, education and more. Whether you’re producing valuable market insights, promoting Australia’s world-class capabilities, or facilitating global connections through our network of 60 offices around the world, you’ll be making a real contribution to Australia’s future. Our National Graduate Program is a tailored 12-month rotational program including our Trade, Investment, Government and Policy, and Visitor Economy and Client Programs Divisions, along with many more opportunities. You will gain access to our fantastic mentoring program, where a dedicated in-house mentor will be provided to you for the entire year, providing you with support to integrate seamlessly into our agency. If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you can post in this thread and an admin will respond.

content: User #592680 788 posts dontbeasavage Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgP9BE posted 2025-Aug-12, 2:11 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP9BE posted 2025-Aug-12, 2:11 pm AEST +1 OA

author: Austrade Grad Mgr
content: User #934241 1 posts Austrade Grad Mgr I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgP9Ey posted 2025-Aug-12, 2:48 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgP9Ey posted 2025-Aug-12, 2:48 pm AEST Hi GradSeeker2025- we offer the program in the locations listed on the original ad – Brisbane, Sydney, Canberra, Melbourne and Adelaide. In your example, yes someone who lives in Geelong would work out of the Melbourne office. If you chose to move to a different city for personal reasons – say Melbourne to Sydney – then you would work out of the Sydney office instead.

content: User #933261 3 posts gradprog2026 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOJji posted 2025-May-16, 5:08 pm AEST edited 2025-May-16, 5:45 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOJji posted 2025-May-16, 5:08 pm AEST (edited 2025-May-16, 5:45 pm AEST) O.P. Hi all, Thought I'd post here that the 2026 ACCC graduate program is now open. Being a recent graduate myself, I can tell you this is an excellent opportunity to start and progress your career in your chosen degree. The work environment is very diverse and inclusive. No matter what your degree is, there is such a large variety of work and different branches in the workplace, that you can choose your pathway once you're in the program. Also, there is a new Digital/Data stream that started last year for the IT/Computer science students that may want to apply. This is highly regarded as one of the best APS grad programs you can get into. It's a very rewarding program, if you have any questions, feel free to message me and I'll do my best to answer. Apply here: https://accc.bigredsky. com/page.php?pageID=160&wind owUID=0&AdvertID=847982

It's honestly so great to hear how many people have had similar positive experiences, and I'm glad you feel the same way. Would you have any advice on the different branches and the variations of work that one could expect, and what each might include? Really appreciate the opportunity to ask questions, thank you!!

author: Skewness
content: User #932864 11 posts Skewness I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPnQr posted 2025-Jun-26, 4:44 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPnQr posted 2025-Jun-26, 4:44 pm AEST Something to keep in mind (from what I can read online) is that this type of aptitude testing is usually designed so that you probably aren’t able to get all the questions right within the time allotment, as that would mean that some portion of the results distribution would be “cut off” by way of that subset of applicants having answered everything correctly, and they would end up with less information.

content: User #932864 11 posts Skewness I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPzzf posted 2025-Jul-7, 1:25 pm AEST edited 2025-Jul-7, 1:53 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPzzf posted 2025-Jul-7, 1:25 pm AEST (edited 2025-Jul-7, 1:53 pm AEST) I’m thinking about sending them an email, not with the intention of having any outcomes reversed, but just to let them know, as the current system definitely creates a bit of an unintuitive result. Especially since future applicants who read this thread will now have to choose between disregarding the rules or seriously disadvantaging their chances. That being said, congrats to those who made it through .

author: leospaceman
content: User #934332 5 posts leospaceman I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPzA3 posted 2025-Jul-7, 1:53 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPzA3 posted 2025-Jul-7, 1:53 pm AEST Agreed, the recruitment process could use improvement. The OA results also seem messy, was confident I did well based with similar OAs…but of course definitely a chance I screwed it up. Wish they sent through feedback reports so at least we know what to work on, surely it’s not that difficult to do for these preset OAs.

author: hat27
content: User #690891 49 posts hat27 Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgPzA9 posted 2025-Jul-7, 1:54 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPzA9 posted 2025-Jul-7, 1:54 pm AEST I’m thinking about sending them an email, not with the intention of having any outcomes reversed, but just to let them know, as the current system definitely creates a bit of an unintuitive result. Especially since future applicants who read this thread will now have to choose between disregarding the rules or seriously disadvantaging their chances. That being said, congrats to those who made it through . Good idea, maybe at least that way they will be aware and can improve things for next year. But seriously what was the point of making no calculators a requirement if the proctoring system they used can’t even account for it? Making no calculators a requirement was just silly imo, no other program had that requirement and I can’t think of a real world setting in which you would have to calculate under time pressure without access to one. Regardless, best of luck to everyone who progressed.

author: soymatchalatte
content: User #933458 11 posts soymatchalatte I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPA22 posted 2025-Jul-8, 9:39 pm AEST edited 2025-Jul-8, 9:44 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPA22 posted 2025-Jul-8, 9:39 pm AEST (edited 2025-Jul-8, 9:44 pm AEST) + rejection (didn't use calculator) I feel like unless they make a statement rectifying the situation this will just encourage further cheating and ignoring instructions in future programs. Disappointed that we were made to do such time-intensive tests, and they couldn't even be bothered to ensure the legitimacy of the assessment process and those of us who followed the rules and invested our time into doing the application right were punished. Perhapsthis is a dodged bullet however if this is a reflection of their department's general standard and quality of work.

author: Skewness
content: User #932864 11 posts Skewness I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPBLD posted 2025-Jul-9, 6:48 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPBLD posted 2025-Jul-9, 6:48 pm AEST With their permission, I thought I’d share the response I received from the ACCC about this: “Thank you for your email and the opportunity to respond to your concerns. We acknowledge we could have been clearer regarding the specific use of calculators in this exercise and that this has resulted in a number of candidates being unclear about how the instructions applied to a calculator. The Numerical Reasoning test was designed to assess a candidate’s ability for higher numerical reasoning (i.e. interpretation and analysis of the data in the questions and associated charts) rather than their ability to complete the simple mathematical arithmetic with the data. Therefore, the use of a calculator will not have affected the outcome of the assessment other than to potentially shorten the time it took to complete. I can confirm that the testing time was designed to include time for pen and paper calculations, so all participants had sufficient time to complete the assessment. In assessing the results, no consideration was given to whether a candidate used a calculator or pen and paper. We take candidate experience very seriously and I am sorry if this has negatively affected your experience with us. We will absolutely be making changes to the instruction page to ensure an improved experience for you and others in future selection processes.”

author: hat27
content: User #690891 49 posts hat27 Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgPCB5 posted 2025-Jul-10, 12:28 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPCB5 posted 2025-Jul-10, 12:28 pm AEST With their permission, I thought I’d share the response I received from the ACCC about this: “Thank you for your email and the opportunity to respond to your concerns. We acknowledge we could have been clearer regarding the specific use of calculators in this exercise and that this has resulted in a number of candidates being unclear about how the instructions applied to a calculator. The Numerical Reasoning test was designed to assess a candidate’s ability for higher numerical reasoning (i.e. interpretation and analysis of the data in the questions and associated charts) rather than their ability to complete the simple mathematical arithmetic with the data. Therefore, the use of a calculator will not have affected the outcome of the assessment other than to potentially shorten the time it took to complete. I can confirm that the testing time was designed to include time for pen and paper calculations, so all participants had sufficient time to complete the assessment. In assessing the results, no consideration was given to whether a candidate used a calculator or pen and paper. We take candidate experience very seriously and I am sorry if this has negatively affected your experience with us. We will absolutely be making changes to the instruction page to ensure an improved experience for you and others in future selection processes.” Well at least they responded but that’s still such a poor response. Not sure I understand how they can brush that off as nothing. As someone else in the thread pointed out the problems weren’t actually that difficult with the use of a calculator, and people who used that would have had significantly more time left over than someone trying to do that on paper. That’s not nothing and is a significant advantage no matter how you try and spin it because a few people struggled to finish on time based on what’s in the thread. And as for “In assessing the results, no consideration was given to whether a candidate used a calculator or pen and paper”?? Cool, so why would you make no calculators an express requirement to begin with if you werent going to give that any consideration? Quite a few of us just ended up doing this on hard mode for nothing. The problem is the unclear instruction for this combined with no feedback makes it very unclear on what basis we were rejected. How bizarre, anyway, glad that’s over and done with. But this was without a doubt an absolute mess.

author: justanotherperson
content: User #932241 5 posts justanotherperson I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPCCi posted 2025-Jul-10, 12:29 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPCCi posted 2025-Jul-10, 12:29 pm AEST I also reached out regarding the entire acquisition process, as it was quite frankly insulting. You can't say that the use of a calculator doesn't impact the overall results significantly when it made people finish the entire section, while others couldn't attempt some questions. I used a calculator (not with malicious intent, I genuinely had no idea we couldn't, and you could see me using one in the video), and felt incredibly confident with my answers, I'm sure I would've gotten a 20/20 in Numerical Reasoning so not progressing just felt like a huge waste of my time?? I also got the exact response, so disappointing it was copied and pasted as opposed to genuinely offering an apology, because if people are confused regarding the tools allowed, I'm not sure how they chose people to progress to the next stage in an unbiased manner. There is no point in talking about it now, but I'm hoping they're at least aware for future candidates.

author: soymatchalatte
content: User #933458 11 posts soymatchalatte I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPCGF posted 2025-Jul-10, 1:25 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPCGF posted 2025-Jul-10, 1:25 pm AEST I received this exact email response too, I showed this to family that work for the public service and they suggested exploring some way of making a complaint or bringing more attention to the issue as this whole issue is really unfair, unprofessional and calls into doubt the department's overall credibility.

author: Eragus
content: User #915415 115 posts Eragus Participant reference: whrl.pl/RgPCKA posted 2025-Jul-10, 2:18 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPCKA posted 2025-Jul-10, 2:18 pm AEST Yeah, this issue is making me doubt how the Graduate Program will be run in 2026. The first post of this thread was gushing about how the ACCC was the best APS Graduate Program, but if this is how the Assessment is run, that credibility is put in doubt.

author: justanotherperson
content: User #932241 5 posts justanotherperson I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgPCK4 posted 2025-Jul-10, 2:24 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgPCK4 posted 2025-Jul-10, 2:24 pm AEST I did mention how the ACCC states certain values they're looking for on their website when hiring candidates, and how this was handled implicitly goes against said values. A bigger complaint might be necessary. This can't happen for future candidates, and it does make me question this program as a whole, if I'm being completely honest. That's incredibly disappointing for me to admit because I wanted this program so much. How would we go about the complaint?

The results of your assessments were reviewed and considered alongside your application form and the assessment criteria to assess your suitability for progression to the next stage. Based on this, we will unfortunately not be progressing your application. We encourage you to review the feedback report provided. Please note that due to the volume of applications received we are unable to provide further individualised feedback at this stage in our recruitment process. This is a very competitive process, and we hope this will not dissuade you from considering Suburban Rail Loop Authority in the future. We thank you for the time and commitment you have shown to our process and wish you every success in securing suitable graduate employment. Kind regards, The Suburban Rail Loop Authority Graduate Team "

thread_title: Scyne Advisory Graduate Program 2026 -  Graduate programs
author: dontbeasavage
content: User #592680 788 posts dontbeasavage Whirlpool Enthusiast reference: whrl.pl/RgOJkY posted 2025-May-16, 5:41 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOJkY posted 2025-May-16, 5:41 pm AEST +1 update email We have now closed applications for our 2026 Graduate Program and are currently screening submissions. Due to an exceptionally high number of applications, the process is taking some time, but I aim to provide an update next week regarding whether you will progress to the next stage. If you have accepted another role or are no longer interested, please let me know so I can close out your application accordingly. Thank you for your time and interest—we truly appreciate the enthusiasm and talent we’ve seen in this year’s applicants! Kind regards Sharon Scyne Graduate Team

It's in the link in the OP What to expect next Brief conversation: We'll arrange a short discussion to get to know you, understand your motivations, explore how you could contribute to our team, and share information about Scyne and the opportunities. Assessment centre: A fun, interactive session with group activities and case studies to see how you think and work with others. Final interview: A one-on-one discussion, including a case study, where you can show off your problem-solving skills and ask us anything. Offer time! If it's a match, we'll send an offer and stay in touch so you're ready to hit the ground running.

author: Sweetcorn01
content: User #932574 5 posts Sweetcorn01 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOg4Q posted 2025-Apr-19, 3:12 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOg4Q posted 2025-Apr-19, 3:12 am AEST I applied for RSM's Indirect Tax GP in early March. However, I wasn't invited to an ac at the time. On the second day after the AC began, the HR team called me, saying my background and CV were a great fit, and they wanted to schedule an interview with the manager. This meant I didn’t go through the usual AC group activity, and the entire recruitment process has been somewhat different from the regular GP process. According to RSM's official website, most GP activities start in February, but some begin in July. The start date of the one I applied for on GradConnection was approximately July 1.I saw posts from candidates who had already received RSM's oc. They mentioned HR asked whether they preferred to start in July or next February. For personal reasons, I would prefer to start next February. The earliest I could start would be September/October of this year, but it’s likely the options are between July this year and February next year. Next week, I have a one-on-one interview with the head of this department. I suspect they might also ask me about my preferred start date during this meeting. The head previously mentioned wanting to expand the team from 14 members to 18 members by the end of the year. Do you think I should politely mention the possibility of starting in February? I'm concerned they might view it as a red flag.

author: taylorswift7
content: User #933311 8 posts taylorswift7 I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOLTX posted 2025-May-19, 1:48 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOLTX posted 2025-May-19, 1:48 pm AEST got rejected after the psychometric testing and struggling to tell where I may have gone wrong? those who got a VI, any tips for me for next time?

author: GradSeeker2025
content: User #910593 216 posts GradSeeker2025 Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgOLWv posted 2025-May-19, 2:14 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOLWv posted 2025-May-19, 2:14 pm AEST You can’t really go ‘wrong’ with psychometric testing since they’re designed to measure how you think under pressure, your reasoning skills, and how well your personality aligns with the role and organisational culture. But I get how frustrating it can be when it’s not clear what they’re looking for, especially since we don’t get structured feedback. You could try tailoring your answers next time based on what you think the department wants but that’s not always genuine or a guarantee. At the end of the day, the right fit goes both ways. You should put your details on the temporary employment register on the careers page. The graduate program might be the most competitive pathway into the department but it’s far from the only pathway. People get in through all sorts of side doors; secondments, temp contracts etc. If you're serious about DFAT, staying engaged with international affairs, sharpening your strategic thinking, and applying through multiple avenues will always work in your favour :)

author: Sidicious Reign
content: User #697391 29 posts Sidicious Reign I'm new here, please be nice reference: whrl.pl/RgOM9r posted 2025-May-20, 6:03 pm AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgOM9r posted 2025-May-20, 6:03 pm AEST I absolutely hated the VI. I can do panels all day – but something about staring at myself really threw me. I also absolutely overprepared trying to anticipate the question and absolutely bombed it. Didn't even finish the 3 minutes!! Goodluck everyone. Judging by previous threads we won't find out until June...

author: GradSeeker2025
content: User #910593 216 posts GradSeeker2025 Forum Regular reference: whrl.pl/RgONyk posted 2025-May-21, 9:23 am AEST ref: whrl.pl/RgONyk posted 2025-May-21, 9:23 am AEST I totally fumbled mine. I feel the same way about watching myself back and that countdown is inherently nerve-wracking! I’m just hoping that each stage isn’t judged solely on its own, and that they’re looking at everything together; CVs, experience, OA test comparability – all of it. Otherwise, there’s no way I’m making it to the next round hahaha.
